comment: I would highly recommend you take this course during the summer. Ignore the old reviews, the professor communicated via email efficiently. If you put in effort and try your best you will find this class easy. There were three tests in the summer semester if you study you can pass. There is homework to do, but it's not hard at all. Great professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: Great professor, responds quickly to work with students, and offers support and empathy when needed.
Her grading style is completely wrong.
Issue after issue and many grading issues. Tried to fail me.

The professor did a great job this semester giving extra credit. She give good feedback and you are graded by a few things. I got a good grade in her class as she is very generous in grading. Overall good experience this semester. I would ignore the old reviews she is very easy to take as long as you put 3-5 hours a week.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Kilinski's class is manageable if you buy the textbook and stay on top of due dates posted in the class calendar or D2L. Her assignments are not particularly hard but they can be time consuming and tedious. She can either be quick at responding to emails or very slow.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: All this professor did as far as instruction was post outdated youtube tutorials. The textbook assignments were very easy to complete and get good grades on. Not a hard class but frustrating, especially if you aren't already familiar with photoshop. Strange grading sometimes. I took this online but know in person students who had similar problems.

Great professor and she really encouraged individual creativity with every project. There are due dates, which is expected. Her critiques are thoughtful. Textbook is challenging but it helps you learn.

Computer Applications in Art was an interesting course. The textbook was somewhat necessary, but I found YouTube videos for the tutorials too late. Adobe Student Plan was required, but I didn't know it was an annual signup, and I will still be paying for it. Projects are easy for an Adobe beginner, got an A. I just wasted more money than I had to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Awful grading system that she doesn't configure properly in D2L (so tracking your grade is a pain). Otherwise pretty much a standard boring easy A professor. Took it online; learned nothing, got the humanities credit and a little GPA padding, no regrets. Tests are pretty easy and the paper is basically free.

She is available to meet outside of any asynchronous class via zoom or teams. There is a consistent rubric for each project, and each project has the same workflow. She gives great feedback, and offers inspiring art history connections. There are a lot of due dates and you need a planner because since this is an asynchronous course. She is caring.
Very difficult class to take online , not enough clear instruction and there are a lot of projects to do that are overall very confusing
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: she makes u analyze so many artwork pieces in 1 chapter and expects u to know everything about them. lectures are 8or9 per week and there is a quiz as well. the questions are overspecific, extremely hard, and just poorly worded. she does not give u nearly enough time for the exams. be prepared to fail every quiz they r impossible to study for
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This professor has a ton of little things due constantly without consistent due dates. So if you take her make sure to get a planner because it is a lot to keep track of. The entire class is taught through youtube videos of random people's tutorials. I don't recommend taking her if you actually want to be taught the programs by a teacher.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: New and very inexperienced prof. Be ready to watch a lot of tutorial vids, and dont expect to leave class before the bell. Follow all instructions TO THE LETTERnothing hard, just nitpicky. The class is not a great source for honest visual critique, either. Wish I could rate her higher, as she is very kind and tries really hard.

This class was fine, I love graphic design but sitting for almost 3 hours in class of tutorials is kind of exhausting. Shes a super kind professor with lots of experiance Projects are fun and pretty open ended but you dont get much in class time to do them so prepare to have them at home. The assigned textbook is ok, make sure you get physical copy
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Class was disorganized and confusing. She kept changing the dates of what was due. Unclear instructions and when asked for clarifications she would defer to the instructions that were confusing to begin with. Showed a lot of demos and if you tried to work ahead of the class she would call you out, so pace of learning could get unnecessary slow.

Many people are understandably worried about the pandemic, but she takes it a bit further than that. She is a new professor and I want to give her leeway for that, but the class can be disorganized and instructions are very confusing. She plays tons of demos during class, which becomes monotonous and difficult to pay attention to after 3 hours.
